p:
Cylindrical samples of 38.1 mm in diameter and 22.9 mm in length were prepared for the purpose of tensile strength testing. The indirect tensile strength testing method (Brazilian test) was used to measure the maximum load that the sample could resist before falling under tension. Then Equation (1) was used to calculate the tensile strength of the sample.
(1)
σ t
=
2 P
π d l
where σ t denotes the Brazilian tensile strength in (MPa), P is the failure load in (N), d and l are the cement sample diameter and length, respectively, both are in (mm).
